sense.name: Lead someone in the wrong direction (physically); give wrong spatial directions.
sense.examples: The pedestrian misled the out-of-town driver. The guide misled the hiking group by providing an outdated map of the trail system.

sense.name: Give false or misleading information to (without explicitly causing and action.)
sense.examples: I was misled by the advertisement's claims. The president was misled by false intelligence reports.

sense.name: Give false or misleading information that explicitly results in an action the part of the person misled.
sense.examples: The company misled many customers into purchasing more credit-data services than needed. The elderly are often misled into spending retirement money on phone scams.
